intro: Hybanthus suffruticosus, commonly known as the hairy hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant is adapted to humid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
